author: JamesWTruher
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
clear the contents of powershell.version
```
PS> $PSVersionTable.GitCommitId
```
Expected behavior
-----------------
```
unknown
```

Actual behavior
---------------
```
Index was outside the bounds of the array.
```

Environment data
----------------

```

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    Index was outside the bounds of the array.
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: The fix should also handle the case if the file is missing, putting the exception message as the GitCommitId value doesn't seem like the right solution

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: The fix should generate a C# file at build time so that we don't need a file at runtime.

title: If powershell.version is present but empty, $PSVersionTable.GitCommitId reports "Index was outside the bounds of the array"
